alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 1:48AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become or remain high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the Fresno Dam. For the Milk River...including Rudyard/E Cross, Havre, Harlem... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.5 feet, Flooding of approximately 4,000 acres of irrigation land. At 23.0 feet, Escape routes for livestock may be cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 22.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 AM MDT Sunday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently forecst to fall below flood stage this evening to 19.3 feet early Tuesday morning. It is then forecast to rise above flood stage late Thursday morning to 21.9 feet early Friday afternoon. It is forecast to fall below flood stage again Sunday evening to 19.9 feet Tuesday, April 25 then rise again. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.8 feet on 03/15/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Harlem 21.0 22.7 Sun 12 am MD 20.2 19.3 19.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM MDT.
